title: Teaching assistant, 20, crashed into a tree and died
text:
A young teaching assistant was killed after a pheasant hit her car as she drove home from university, an inquest heard today.

Natalie Haywood died when her Vauxhall Corsa hit a tree on the B1183 at Scrivelsby, near Horncastle in Lincolnshire, on January 22.

The 20-year-old teaching assistant, from Stickney, near Boston, was taken to Lincoln County Hospital but died of her injuries shortly after the crash.

Natalie Haywood died when her Vauxhall Corsa hit a tree as she drove home form university

Ms Hawyood was on her way home from university after handing in a 10,000-word essay which she had been 'stressed about all over Christmas'.

Police were called to the scene at 5.49pm where they found the bird on the opposite carriageway.

PC Mark Brown, a forensic investigator with Lincolnshire Police, told Lincoln Coroners' Court Ms Haywood lost control of the car on a bend.

He said: 'The driver was the only occupant of the car, she was approaching a right hand bend, losing control.

'The car impacted with a substantial tree and a full police investigation took place. The cause of death was multiple injuries. She was travelling south east at the time.'

He said the pheasant was found on the northbound carriage shortly after police arrived.

Ms Haywood's car hit a tree on the B1183 at Scrivelsby, near Horncastle in Lincolnshire, on January 22. Pictured, floral tributes left at the scene

PC Brown added: 'It is more likely a pheasant or animal caused her to be distracted.

'Some left-hand steering needed to be applied so it's a more obvious explanation of the collision.'

He added there was an unexplained mark on the bonnet which was not caused by the impact with the tree but was 'characteristic of an animal strike'.

Natalie's mother Christine Haywood, who attended the inquest with friends and family, said: 'She was a very bubbly, outgoing person who always had a smile on her face - she loved her family.

'She handed a 10,000 word essay for her university course, she was stressed about it all over Christmas - she was at Bishop Grossteste University in Lincoln studying childcare and was on her way back because the weather was closing in.'

Coroner Paul Cooper said: 'It was a tragic road accident, it's nobody's fault.'
description: Natalie Haywood died when her Vauxhall Corsa hit a tree on the B1183 in Lincolnshire, on  January 22. The 20-year-old was on her way home after handing in an essay.
